message.content:
cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.DM, cs.GT, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with approximation algorithms for the Steiner tree problem, which is a classic problem in computer science and falls under the category of algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). The paper heavily exploits methods and results from the theory of matroids and submodular functions, which are topics in discrete mathematics (cs.DM) and graph theory (cs.CG). The paper also discusses the integrality gap of hypergraphic LP relaxations, which is a topic in optimization and theoretical computer science (cs.GT). Finally, the paper presents a fast algorithm for quasi-bipartite graphs, which is a specific type of graph and falls under the category of graph theory (cs.LG).
